node.title: Queensland set to loosen COVID border restrictions, with 1.6m people unvaccinated in the state
node.description: As the state prepares to relax some border rulesÂ after reaching a vaccine milestone yesterday, one expert warns there is a "very real risk of chains of transmission kicking off and spreading dangerously" with so many people still to get a single COVID jab.
node.content:
["About 1.6 million Queensland residents remain unvaccinated against COVID-19, as the state prepares to open borders to inoculated travellers flying in from virus hotspots interstate.", "Queensland crashed through the 70 per cent double vaccination target for those aged 16 and older yesterday, heralding an easing of border restrictions.", "While welcoming the move to reunite families, infectious disease expert Robert Booy warned of the \"very real risk of chains of transmission kicking off and spreading dangerously\" with so many people still to get a single COVID jab.", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk will outline when people can start applying for border passes under the relaxed restrictions at a news conference today.", "But only people who have received two doses of a COVID vaccine, have tested negative to the virus in the previous 72 hours and can safely home quarantine for 14 days will be eligible to fly in from interstate hotspots.", "Federal government data shows 81.99 per cent of the Queensland population aged 16 and older \u2014\u00a0or 3.37 million people \u2014 have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine and 70.25 per cent have had two shots.", "Another 156,000 Queenslanders aged 12 to 15 have had one jab and 103,000 are fully vaccinated.", "But that still leaves about 1.6 million Queenslanders who are yet to receive a single dose of a COVID vaccine, which includes children aged 11 and younger.", "Australia is not expected to start vaccinating children aged under 12 until next year.", "
Call to expand vaccine mandate to teachers
", "Professor Booy, of the University of Sydney, said Queensland still had \"a significant minority of people who are at risk and unvaccinated\".", "He joined the Australian Medical Association's state president Chris Perry in calling on the Sunshine State to expand COVID-19 vaccine mandates to include teachers, given how easily the virus can spread from children to adults.", "\"A teacher as young as in their 30s is at four times the risk of serious COVID compared to a teenager they teach,\" Professor Booy said.", "\"A teacher in their 50s is at 40 times the risk of serious COVID compared with a teenager they teach.", "\"I don't think the booster shots need to be mandated but once people have been safely vaccinated, the trust is built, the confidence increases and they feel safe to have a booster too.\"", "Dr Perry said the AMA's biggest concern was \"the disproportionate number of Aboriginal people who aren't vaccinated\".", "The ear, nose and throat surgeon, who has worked extensively in First Nations communities, said he was worried about unvaccinated Indigenous patients swamping hospital intensive care units as Queensland opened up leading into Christmas.", "Indigenous people are considered particularly vulnerable to the virus, given high rates of chronic disease.", "\"With so many elders who are unvaccinated\u00a0and so many people living in the one household, they can easily overwhelm our system,\" Dr Perry said.", "
New strains could emerge in neighbouring countries
", "As the Queensland vaccine rollout continues, Mater Health Services director of infectious diseases Paul Griffin joined Professor Booy in calling on the federal government to ramp up Australia's supplies of free COVID shots to developing Asian and Pacific countries.", "\"No-one is safe until everybody is and there are lots of countries that have had very little access to these vaccines,\" said Dr Griffin, an associate professor at the University of Queensland.", "\"The situation there is very challenging and it does pose a risk directly to Australia, in addition to obviously trying to do the right thing by those countries. We should try and do more.\"", "Professor\u00a0Booy said experts were concerned about more dangerous variants of SARS-CoV-19, the virus that causes COVID-19, emerging in countries with low vaccination rates.", "\"We'll have COVID come back to bite us because ongoing transmission overseas in the Pacific and in Asia will lead to ongoing mutation and the potential for a variant against which vaccines and drugs don't work,\" he said.", "\"We're giving away millions of doses. I think we need to give away tens of millions of doses.", "\"The government is doing well but it can do so much better. By helping our neighbours we help ourselves.\"", "Despite Queensland reaching the 70 per cent double vaccination target for those aged 16 and older yesterday, it trails all other states except for Western Australia (69.77 per cent) when it comes to rates of residents who have received two COVID shots.", "But after strong vaccination turnouts during the weekend, Health Minister Yvette D'Ath praised Queenslanders for \"kicking this out of the park\".", "\"We are absolutely on our way to not just meeting our 80 per cent target as well, but getting to that 90 per cent target,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"We are well on our way to seeing 90 per cent of eligible Queenslanders having their first dose before Christmas.\""]
